ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: ros, aspects of ML, particle filters, camera math, lots of cool robotics stuff

Intro to robotics, reinforcement learning, controls, HCI, hands-on experience programming an interactive robot for final project. High level overview of interesting ML topics through quizzes. Exposure to seminal papers in ML through paper presentations.
The course introduces students how to use ROS and simple machine learning methods through hands on projects which is useful for anyone thinking of going into machine intelligence and robotics
Knowledge and skills in robotics, HCI, ML and RL
Topics on robot localization, control, and optimization
Broad range of topics within robotics - decision making, reinforcement learning, filters. Also learned to use Robot Operating System (ROS) through two homeworks and a final project.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths are getting to work on the final project, really engaging lectures, well written assignments, and a lot of support. No weaknesses.

The strength is that its a small course so you get a lot of help from Marynel and the TA if you seek it. Also the final project is a great way to try out a robotics project for the first time and learn a lot
Interesting materials, fair grading, slightly heavy workload

strength: covers a wide range of topics
Weakness: ROS was central to the course but we didn't have a guide of it in the beginning

Really amazing course that covers a huge range of topics within robotics and gives students the opportunity for lots of hands on experience. I don't think many courses could pull off covering such a broad range of topics, but Marynel is a really amazing teacher that makes it work.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it's a great way to get into working with robots and thinking about HRI while also just building a cool final project in the end
Yes! Just be ready to put in a little bit of time on the two assignments if you dont come from a robotics background. There is a lot of support though and plenty of time to finish them.
Yes. Definitely take it if youre interested in working on a robotics project. Its one of the few courses at Yale where you can actually work on building AI models.
Yes, the course is insightful for students who are interested in robotics
Yes, if you are considering getting to know how robots work

Yes, without hesitation! I wasn't particularly interested in robotics going into this class, but really wanted to take a class that covered reinforcement learning. Despite this, I got so much out of this class.
